textBox.richText: Vedrana Krivokuća is joining the team

Vedrana Krivokuca is joining the biometrics group at Idiap in January 2017 to work on a biometric template protection. Welcome Vedrana ! Vedrana Krivokuća is joining the biometrics group at Idiap in January 2017 as a postdoc in biometric template protection. Vedrana obtained her PhD in Computer Systems Engineering from the University of Auckland (New Zealand) in 2015. Her thesis, entitled “Fingerprint Template Protection using Compact Minutiae Patterns”, proposes a novel approach for securing fingerprint templates when they are stored in a central database. Vedrana’s main research interests include biometric security (with a particular focus on biometric template protection), information theory, pattern recognition, and image processing. She is looking forward to joining forces with Idiap’s talented researchers to find new and better ways of safeguarding people’s security and privacy in our interconnected world.
Vedrana Krivokuća is joining the team
